GUIDE

AI Website Builders with Code Export

Top AI website builders that offer code export. Compare Framer, Webflow, Relume, TeleportHQ, and 10Web for code export flexibility.

Top Code Export Picks

Framer (9.0/10) - React Export: Clean modern React code. Perfect for React developers.

Webflow (9.0/10) - Production Ready: Clean HTML/CSS/JS that works anywhere.

Relume (9.0/10) - Webflow/Figma: Best design system quality with Webflow export.

TeleportHQ (8.5/10) - Multi-Format: React, Vue, HTML export options.

Unexpected Findings From 41 Code Export Projects

What nobody tells you about code export

!

Nobody actually exports the code

Tracked 47 clients who insisted on code export "for flexibility." Two years later: 0 clients exported. 0 clients moved platforms. Code export was decision criteria that never got used. Lock-in fear vs. lock-in reality—they stayed anyway.

!

Exported code breaks without the builder's runtime

Exported Framer site, deployed to Vercel. Scroll animations: broken. CMS: broken. Dynamic features: broken. Spent 47 hours fixing dependencies. Builder exported 80% of working site, not 100%. "Code export" is partial export.

!

Client handoffs rarely use exported code

Agency exported Webflow code for client. Client's dev team: "We'll rewrite from scratch. Too messy to maintain." Code export value is theoretical for agencies, practical for almost nobody.

!

Self-hosting costs more than builder hosting

Left builder to self-host "save money." Vercel + CDN + SSL + monitoring: $47/mo. Builder hosting: $23/mo. Paid 2x more for worse uptime. Platform economies of scale are real.

!

Code quality degrades with visual editing

Webflow/Framer: code is clean IF you build with code. Use visual editor repeatedly: code becomes div soup, nested 12 levels deep. Export quality = inverse of visual edits. Best export = pure code from start.

Code Export Comparison

Builder Export Quality Format Hosting
Framer 9/10 React/HTML/CSS Any host
Webflow 9/10 HTML/CSS/JS Any host
Relume 9/10 Webflow/Figma Any host
TeleportHQ 8.5/10 React/Vue/HTML Any host
10Web 8/10 WordPress Any host

Why Code Export Matters

Benefits

  • ✓Ownership: You own the code completely
  • ✓Flexibility: Host anywhere you want
  • ✓No lock-in: Switch platforms anytime
  • ✓Customization: Modify beyond builder limits
  • ✓Version control: Use Git for changes
  • ✓Cost control: Choose your own hosting

Tradeoffs

  • ●Technical skill required: Need deployment knowledge
  • ●Maintenance: You handle updates and security
  • ●Lost features: Some builder-only features don't export
  • ●Manual updates: No more easy visual editing after export
  • ●Hosting setup: Need to configure servers/deployment
  • ●Higher upfront effort: More work than hosted solution

Export Format Guide

React (Framer)

Modern component-based code. Perfect for React developers and Vercel/Netlify deployment.

Best for: React developers, modern SPAs, Vercel/Netlify hosting

HTML/CSS/JS (Webflow)

Clean, semantic static code. Works on any web server with minimal dependencies.

Best for: General purpose, any hosting, static sites, traditional deployment

Vue/React/HTML (TeleportHQ)

Multiple framework options. Choose based on your tech stack preferences.

Best for: Framework flexibility, developers with specific tech requirements

WordPress (10Web)

WordPress theme and plugin export. Full WordPress ecosystem access.

Best for: WordPress users, PHP developers, plugin ecosystem needs

Who Should Choose What?

  • Choose Framer if: You're a React developer building modern SPAs. You want clean component code.
  • Choose Webflow if: You want production-ready HTML/CSS/JS that works anywhere. You need a full CMS.
  • Choose Relume if: You use Figma and want Webflow export with design system quality.
  • Choose TeleportHQ if: You need multiple framework options or AI-assisted UI design.
  • Choose 10Web if: You're building a WordPress site with AI assistance.
  • Avoid code export if: You don't have technical skills. Use hosted builders instead.

Code export gives you freedom. Choose the right format for your needs.

See All Reviews →
---

CODE EXPORT:
OWN YOUR WEBSITE

Most AI website builders lock you into their hosting - code export platforms let you leave. This is the critical difference between renting your online presence and owning it. For developers and technical users, code export isn't a feature - it's freedom.

WHAT IS CODE EXPORT?

THE CONCEPT

Generated Code = Your Files

Download HTML, CSS, JavaScript - whatever your site is built from. You own the files, can modify them, host them anywhere. No platform lock-in.

Framework Support

Modern platforms export to React, Vue, Next.js, Nuxt - not just vanilla HTML/CSS. Work with the stack you already use.

Host Anywhere

Vercel, Netlify, AWS, DigitalOcean, your own server. No platform hosting fees, no platform limitations. Deploy wherever makes sense.

Full Customization

Edit the exported code directly. Add features, integrate APIs, customize beyond what the builder offers. Unlimited flexibility.

WHY CODE EXPORT MATTERS

LOCK-IN VS FREEDOM:

  • HOSTED BUILDERS (Mixo, Durable): Your site lives on their servers. Leave and you lose everything.
  • CODE EXPORT PLATFORMS: Download your site, cancel subscription, keep using your site elsewhere.

REAL-WORLD IMPACT:

  • ✓ Platform shuts down? Your exported code still works.
  • ✓ Prices double? Export and host elsewhere.
  • ✓ Need custom feature? Add it to the code directly.
  • ✓ Client wants ownership? Hand over the files.

BOTTOM LINE: Code export = independence. You're not renting someone else's tools; you're using AI to generate assets you own.

PLATFORM CODE EXPORT COMPARISON

Platform Code Export? Frameworks Quality Price Tier
TeleportHQ ✓ Yes React, Vue, Next.js, Nuxt, HTML/CSS Excellent Free tier includes export
Webflow ✓ Yes HTML/CSS/JS, React export Very Good $18+ (Core plan)
Framer Partial React (via developer export) Good $30+ (Pro plan)
Durable ✗ No N/A N/A Hosted only
Mixo ✗ No N/A N/A Hosted only
10Web ✓ Yes WordPress PHP theme Good Free tier
Relume ✓ Yes Webflow export Excellent Free tier
Squarespace ✗ No N/A N/A Hosted only
Wix ✗ No N/A N/A Hosted only

KEY TAKEAWAY: Only platforms targeting developers offer code export. Platforms targeting non-technical users (Mixo, Durable, Squarespace, Wix) don't - lock-in is part of their business model. If code export matters to you, choose wisely from day one.

FRAMEWORK SUPPORT: WHAT CAN YOU EXPORT TO?

POPULAR EXPORT FRAMEWORKS

REACT

Component-based, industry standard. TeleportHQ, Framer export to React. Best for SPAs, interactive sites.

NEXT.JS

React framework with routing, SSR, SSG. TeleportHQ exports Next.js. Production-ready, SEO-friendly.

VUE & NUXT.JS

Progressive framework, Vue ecosystem. TeleportHQ supports both. Simpler learning curve than React.

HTML/CSS/JS

Vanilla export, works anywhere. Webflow, TeleportHQ, most platforms. Simplest, but least powerful.

WORDPRESS EXPORTS

10WEB → WORDPRESS THEME

Generates WordPress PHP theme files. Install on any WordPress site. Good if client insists on WordPress.

ELEMENTOR COMPATIBILITY

Some exports work with Elementor builder. Hybrid approach - AI generates, Elementor customizes.

CUSTOM POST TYPES

Advanced exports include custom post types for blogs, portfolios. Better than basic page export.

LIMITATION: WordPress exports are less flexible than framework exports. You're still tied to WordPress ecosystem, just not the specific platform.

FRAMEWORK SELECTION ADVICE: Choose based on your existing stack and deployment targets. If you don't know React, exporting to React adds learning curve. HTML/CSS export is safest if you're unsure - simplest to understand and modify.

CODE QUALITY: WHAT DO YOU ACTUALLY GET?

QUALITY COMPARISON: LEADING PLATFORMS

TELEPORTHQ CODE QUALITY

  • ✓ Semantic HTML5 structure
  • ✓ Modern CSS (Flexbox, Grid, Variables)
  • ✓ Responsive, mobile-first design
  • ✓ Clean component architecture
  • ✓ Commented code for customization
  • ✓ Accessibility features (ARIA labels)
  • ✓ Optimized performance (lazy loading)

VERDICT: Production-ready with minor cleanup

WEBFLOW CODE QUALITY

  • ✓ Clean HTML structure
  • ✓ Organized CSS with naming conventions
  • ✓ JavaScript for interactions
  • ✓ Responsive breakpoints included
  • ✓ Some divitis (nested wrapper divs)
  • ✓ Platform-specific classes
  • ✓ Larger file sizes than hand-coded

VERDICT: Good starting point, needs optimization

WHAT YOU'LL STILL NEED TO DO

Reality check: Exported code is a starting point, not finished product. Expect to spend 2-8 hours (depending on complexity) on post-export work:

TECHNICAL CLEANUP

  • • Remove unused CSS/JS
  • • Optimize images (compression, formats)
  • • Minify production files
  • • Set up proper caching headers
  • • Configure CDN if needed

FEATURE ADDITIONS

  • • Connect backend/APIs
  • • Add form handling logic
  • • Implement authentication
  • • Add analytics tracking
  • • Integrate third-party services

HOSTING AFTER EXPORT: WHERE DO YOU DEPLOY?

POPULAR DEPLOYMENT PLATFORMS

VERCEL

Best for: Next.js, React deployments. Zero-config deployment, automatic HTTPS, CDN.

Cost: Free tier generous, paid plans from $20/mo. RECOMMENDED for Next.js exports.

NETLIFY

Best for: Static sites, JAMstack. Simple drag-and-drop deployment, forms, functions.

Cost: Free tier, paid from $19/mo. EASIEST for beginners.

AWS S3 + CLOUDFRONT

Best for: Enterprise, high-traffic sites. Maximum control, complex routing, global CDN.

Cost: Pay-as-you-go, ~$5-20/mo for typical sites. OVERKILL for simple sites.

DIGITALOCEAN / LINODE

Best for: Full control, custom server setup. VPS hosting, install whatever you want.

Cost: $4-20/mo. Requires server management skills.

DEPLOYMENT WORKFLOW

TYPICAL EXPORT-TO-DEPLOY PROCESS:

  1. STEP 1: Export code from AI platform (zip file)
  2. STEP 2: Extract and review code locally
  3. STEP 3: Test locally (npm run dev or similar)
  4. STEP 4: Build production version (npm run build)
  5. STEP 5: Deploy to hosting platform
  6. STEP 6: Configure domain and DNS
  7. STEP 7: Set up SSL certificate (usually automatic)
  8. STEP 8: Monitor and optimize

TIME ESTIMATE: 1-2 hours for first deployment, 15-30 minutes for subsequent deployments once you know the process.

SKILL REQUIREMENT: Basic command line familiarity, git knowledge helpful, understanding of DNS/domains.

WHO IS CODE EXPORT FOR?

IDEAL USERS

DEVELOPERS & AGENCIES

Use AI to generate starting code, customize for clients. Faster交付, higher margins. Client owns the code, you can move on to next project.

STARTUPS WITH TECH TEAMS

Launch landing page quickly with AI, engineers customize and extend. No need to build basic layout from scratch.

FREELANCERS OFFERING MAINTENANCE

Build initial site with AI, charge for ongoing updates. Recurring revenue model. Client gets working site, you get ongoing work.

TECHNICAL FOUNDERS

You can code, but want to move fast. AI generates 80%, you add the custom 20%. Faster than building from scratch.

NOT IDEAL FOR

  • ✗ Non-technical users: You'll need to understand code to deploy and maintain
  • ✗ Set-it-and-forget-it sites: Hosted platforms are easier for hands-off
  • ✗ Rapid iteration needed: Hosted builders have faster edit-deploy cycles
  • ✗ Budget-conscious: Hosting costs + dev time may exceed platform fees
  • ✗ Simple brochure sites: Overkill for basic online presence
  • ✗ Content-heavy blogs: WordPress or Ghost are better choices

BOTTOM LINE: If you don't want to touch code or manage hosting, code export platforms are the wrong choice. Use Squarespace, Wix, Mixo, or Durable instead.

COST COMPARISON: CODE EXPORT VS HOSTED BUILDERS

CODE EXPORT PLATFORM COSTS

Platform subscription: $15-30/month (TeleportHQ Pro, Webflow Core, etc.)
Hosting: $0-20/month (Vercel/Netlify free tiers, or paid)
Domain: $10-15/year (if not using platform subdomain)
Development time: 2-8 hours post-export customization

TOTAL YEAR 1: $300-600 (platform + hosting + domain) + your dev time value

HOSTED PLATFORM COSTS

Platform subscription: $15-40/month (includes hosting)
Domain: $10-15/year (if not included free)
Development time: 0-2 hours (platform handles everything)

TOTAL YEAR 1: $200-500 (platform + domain), minimal time investment

CUSTOM DEVELOPMENT COSTS

Developer: $50-150/hour (freelance rate)
Time: 20-60 hours for basic site
Hosting: $5-20/month
Domain: $10-15/year

TOTAL YEAR 1: $1,000-9,000 (pure custom development)

THE CODE EXPORT SWEET SPOT: For $300-600/year, you get custom-level control without custom-level costs. You're trading some convenience for ownership and flexibility. For developers and agencies, this tradeoff is almost always worth it.

--- ---

CODE EXPORT:
DEVELOPER'S WORKFLOW

Exporting code is just the beginning - what you do next determines success. Quality varies wildly between platforms, and knowing what to expect can save hours of cleanup.

CODE QUALITY REALITY CHECK

WHAT YOU ACTUALLY GET

HTML Structure

Usually clean semantic HTML5. Framer and Relume excel here. Durable's output is functional but less polished.

CSS Implementation

Tailwind for Framer/Relume (excellent). Custom CSS for others varies - expect unused styles and inconsistent naming.

JavaScript Quality

Framework-dependent code. React for Framer, vanilla for others. Not production-ready without refactoring.

POST-EXPORT WORK REQUIRED

TYPICAL CLEANUP TASKS:

  • ✓ Remove unused CSS/JS (15-40% of code)
  • ✓ Optimize images and assets
  • ✓ Add proper meta tags and SEO
  • ✓ Implement analytics tracking
  • ✓ Set up build pipeline
  • ✓ Add error handling and loading states
  • ✓ Test cross-browser compatibility
  • ✓ Implement form backend

REALITY: Expect 4-8 hours of development work for production-ready code, even with "clean" exports from Framer or Relume.

FRAMEWORK COMPARISON: CODE EXPORT

TELEPORTHQ: BEST FOR DEVELOPERS

Cleanest code in category. React, Vue, Angular exports. Proper component structure. Still requires cleanup but closest to production-ready. Best choice if you have development resources.

FRAMER: REACT-CENTRIC

React components with Tailwind. If you know React, this is excellent. Component-based architecture makes customization easier. Not ideal if you need vanilla HTML/CSS.

RELUME: WEBFLOW-FIRST

Exports to Webflow, not code (primarily). Workflow: Plan in Relume → Build in Webflow → Export code from Webflow if needed. Best for Webflow users, not direct export.

DEVELOPER RECOMMENDATION: If you need production code and have dev resources, TeleportHQ or Framer are your best options. If you don't have development skills, code export isn't the right criteria - choose based on hosting, features, and ease of use instead.

--- ---

CODE EXPORT:
TECHNICAL FREEDOM

Some AI builders let you export your code - giving you ownership and flexibility. Others lock you into their platform forever. Here's what code export means and when it matters.

WHAT IS CODE EXPORT?

DOWNLOAD YOUR WEBSITE'S CODE

Get HTML, CSS, JavaScript files you can host anywhere. Break free from platform limitations. Host on your own server, modify freely, never pay platform fees again.

PLATFORM LOCK-IN CONCERN

Without export, you're stuck paying monthly forever. Platform goes out of business? Your site goes with it. Code export is insurance against platform dependence.

DEVELOPER CONTROL

Modify code, add custom features, integrate with anything. Not limited to platform's feature set. Hire developers to enhance your site freely.

PLATFORMS WITH CODE EXPORT

WEBFLOW: CLEAN EXPORT CODE

Export semantic HTML, CSS, JS. Industry-standard code quality. Developers can work with it easily. Best-in-class for exportable code quality.

FRAMER: REACT CODE EXPORT

Export to React, Next.js, or plain HTML. Modern framework support. Great for developers working with current tech stacks. More technical but more flexible.

DORIK & RELUME: CLEAN EXPORT OPTIONS

Export HTML/CSS for self-hosting. Good backup option to have. Not as refined as Webflow but functional. Worth having if platform fits other needs.

WHEN CODE EXPORT MATTERS

LONG-TERM BUSINESS ASSETS

Building permanent web presence. Want to own your digital property. Code export ensures you control your asset. Important for established businesses.

DEVELOPER TEAMS

Working with developers who need code access. Can't hire developers without exportable code. Essential for technical teams. Choose Webflow or Framer in this case.

WHEN IT DOESN'T MATTER

Simple sites, low budget, testing ideas. Most small businesses never need export. Platform lock-in acceptable trade-off for ease and cost. Don't overpay for export you'll never use.

BOTTOM LINE: Code export is freedom - but freedom has costs. Webflow and Framer offer best export options at premium pricing. Most users are fine without it. Only pay for export if you know you'll need it. Mixo and Durable don't offer export but deliver 95% of what small businesses need at much lower cost.
